p.s: To persuade the audience, that dreams are worth fighting for (l. 25f.), Barack Obama uses several rhetorical devices, which will be analyzed in the following.
In the first sentences he uses a rhetorical device, in form of a Hyperbolehyperbole.
He underlines, that his home state Illinois is just a stone's throw away (l. 2) from Bettendorf, where he held his speech.
Thus he builtsbuilds up a relation with the people from Bettendorf and engages them to identify themselfthemselves with the candidate.

Obama emphasizes, that In big cities and small towns, among man and woman, young and old, black, white and brown the faith into common dreams is the same.
